result.execSummary:
The defendant Margaret E Borgwardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation. (to be paid to Erica M.)

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Be compliant with all orders of Courts with competent jurisdiction.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Margaret E Borgwardt in court with attorney Gerald S. Boisits.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court proceeds to plea/sentencing.      Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 and 3 dismissed and read-in.  


Court orders the following: 
Count 2:
- 90 days jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail;  consecutive
- Restitution in the amount of $146.02 (to be paid to Erica M.) to be paid as a condition of probation.
- Conditions of Probation: Be Compliant with all orders of Courts with competent jurisdiction.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. DNA surcharge is waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Margaret E Borgwardt in court with attorney Gerald S. Boisits.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion to modify bail. Atty. Boisits states they may be resolving this matter. The bail motion is withdrawn by Defense. Atty. Boisits is requesting a date in a week. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
To modify bail, filed by Atty Boisits.
Hearing on September 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Margaret E Borgwardt in court with attorney Gerald S. Boisits.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: August 7, 2014 Preliminary Hearing (Digital Recording).
Arraignment on August 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Margaret E Borgwardt in court with attorney Gerald S. Boisits.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern supervised by Debra Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting that all witnesses be excluded from the courtroom. Defense does not object. Court grants the request. Officer K. Dingman from the Village of Big Bend Police Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. Defense moves to dismiss. Court denied at this time.  Nicole H. was sworn and testified on behalf of the defense. Cross examination by the state. Defense rests. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with alleged victims or their residence listed in the Criminal Complaint except as permitted pursuant to any juvenile court orders that provides supervised placement.

Defendant Margaret E Borgwardt in court with attorney Gerald S Boisits.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State is requesting that there be no contact. Court grants the request to modify the bail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with alleged victims or their residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
